itinerary.title: Arrive Cairo 'Welcome to Egypt'
itinerary.activities: Upon your arrival at Cairo International Airport, you will be met by your Memphis Tours Representative who will accompany you to your hotel in Cairo for check-in and a free welcome drink. There you will be introduced to your Tour Manager for the trip who will explain your itinerary fully and answer all your questions. After check-in, you are free to spend the rest of the day/evening at your leisure. There is a wonderful opportunity to do an optional excursion to the Sound & Light Show on Giza Plateau, by the magnificent Pyramids.

itinerary.title: Pyramids and Cairo Sightseeing
itinerary.activities: Start your day with a refreshing breakfast at your hotel. Then, meet your experienced personal guide to launch your first day of sightseeing. Visit the highlights of Cairo, starting at the Giza plateau. You'll see the Great Pyramid of Cheops, Chephren, and Mykerinus, the famous Sphinx, and the Valley Temple. Following lunch in a local restaurant, continue to the Egyptian Museum and explore its treasures, including the Treasury room of King Tutankhamen. Conclude the day by exploring Islamic Cairo and its wonders, including Khan El Khalili (Cairo's old Bazaar).

itinerary.title: Fly to Aswan - Aswan sightseeing
itinerary.activities: After an early breakfast in your Cairo hotel, transfer to Cairo Airport for your flight to Aswan. Upon arrival, meet our Memphis Tours representative and commence your day of Aswan sightseeing. Visit the majestic Philae Temple, built in devotion to Isis and Hathor. Conclude the day with a visit to the Unfinished Obelisk nested in the stone quarries of Ancient Egypt.

itinerary.title: Tour to the magnificent Abu Simbel Temples
itinerary.activities: In the early morning, you'll be picked up from your hotel in Aswan for a small group tour to Abu Simbel. Visit the two uniquely styled Temples of Abu Simbel, masterpieces of ancient Egypt. Start with the Temple of Ramses II, dedicated to four universal gods. Then, visit the Temple of Queen Nefertari, also called the Temple of Hathor. Afterwards, you'll be escorted back to your cruise ship in Aswan.

itinerary.title: Kom Ombo & Edfu Temples
itinerary.activities: After breakfast onboard, sail to the splendid Kom Ombo and Edfu Temples. Begin with a visit to the twin Temple of Kom Ombo, constructed as a tribute to Sobek and Horus. After lunch onboard, head to the Temple of Edfu, one of the best-preserved temples in Egypt. In the afternoon, enjoy some relaxation with tea as you sail to Luxor, spending the night onboard your cruise.

itinerary.title: Luxor Nile Cruise
itinerary.activities: After breakfast onboard, continue sailing to Luxor. Once docked, visit the West Bank of Luxor, specifically the Valley of the Kings, the royal burial ground for over 62 pharaohs. Next, visit the Temple of Queen Hatshepsut and the Colossi of Memnon. Return to the cruise ship for lunch and afternoon tea, spending the night onboard in Luxor.

optionalTour.name: Hot Air Balloon Ride Trip
optionalTour.description: A spectacular early morning sunrise adventure in this hot air balloon ride over Luxor with breathtaking views over the Valley of the Kings.

itinerary.title: East bank and Go to Hurghada
itinerary.activities: After breakfast, visit the crown jewels of Luxor's attractions: the Karnak and Luxor Temples on the East bank. Home to the biggest hypostyle hall in ancient Egyptian history, it's a sight to behold. After the tour, transfer to Hurghada (approximately 4 hours drive), a exciting resort destination on the pristine Red Sea. Check into your hotel and enjoy free time at leisure.

itinerary.title: Free day at Leisure in Hurghada
itinerary.activities: After breakfast, enjoy a free day to explore Hurghada. Choose from many activities such as windsurfing, sailing, and deep-sea fishing, which are just a fraction of the exciting things to do in Hurghada Red Sea Egypt.

itinerary.title: Hurghada & Back to Cairo
itinerary.activities: After breakfast, spend your day at leisure to relax. Later, you will be transferred to the airport for your flight to Cairo. Upon arrival in Cairo, you will be assisted and transferred to your hotel for free time.

itinerary.title: Fly Back Home
itinerary.activities: Following breakfast, you will be met by our representative who will transfer you to Cairo Airport for your flight back home.

packages.tourType: Private tour in Cairo & group tour onboard the cruise (English speaking guide)

itinerary.title: Arrive Cairo 'Welcome to Egypt'
itinerary.activities: After safely Landing in Cairo International Airport, You will be assisted by a Memphis Tours Representative who will transfer you to your hotel by a private air-conditioned vehicle. Upon arrival at the Hotel, your Representative will assist you with a smooth check-in and give you detailed information concerning your pick up times during your Egypt Trip Package and sightseeing plans preparing you for one of your best trips to Cairo spending the night in your exquisite Cairo Hotel.

itinerary.title: Giza Pyramids and Cairo Museum
itinerary.activities: After breakfast at your Hotel in Cairo and then you will be picked up by your personal expert English speaking Tour Guide who will accompany you to your first location and throughout your trips to Cairo. Kicking off with the Giza Plateau to visit one of the seven wonders of the ancient world, the Great Pyramids of Cheops, Chefren and Mykerinus, famous Sphinx at the Valley Temple facing the great statue. Lunch will be served at a good quality local restaurant, then Continue to visit the world-renowned Egyptian Museum in Cairo that was built in neo-classical style and designed by the French architect Marcel Dourgnon. The museum's vast collection of over 120,000 artefacts ranges from pre-dynastic era, through the Pharaonic era to the Greco-Roman period of Egypt. Amongst the most famous & fascinating items, you might encounter in all of your Egypt Trip Package are the funerary treasures of the child King Tutankhamun, the colossal statues of the heretic king, Akhenaten, and the only surviving image of Khufu, creator of Egypt's Great Pyramid. Visiting the Egyptian Museum is a great introduction to learning about the ancient Egyptian civilization, including their famous art of mummification. Finally, you will be transferred back to your hotel for an overnight stay in Cairo.

itinerary.title: Fly to Aswan - Aswan sightseeing
itinerary.activities: Proceeding An early breakfast at your Hotel in Cairo, you will be transferred to Cairo Airport Domestic Terminal for your flight to Aswan in preparation for your Nile Cruise. On arrival in Aswan, you will be met by your Tour Guide and commence your day of Aswan tours, an essential part of your Egypt Trip Package starting with the ‘Unfinished Obelisk’ which still lay in the granite quarries that provided ancient Egypt with building materials. It would have been the largest piece of stone ever handled but when a crack was discovered it was abandoned where it was being hewn. Cross by boat to Agilkia Island, to see the Temple of Isis at Philae Temple which is one of the Nubian Temples rescued before the High Dam was built. Enjoy Philae’s long colonnades, towers, and reliefs which include the last surviving hieroglyphic and demotic inscriptions in Egypt. You will then embark on your Luxor Nile Cruise with time to explore the City of Aswan with dinner on board and overnight stay on the Cruise ship in Aswan on your Luxor Nile Cruise.

itinerary.title: Kom Ombo & Edfu Temples
itinerary.activities: After breakfast onboard, sail to the splendid Kom Ombo and Edfu Temples. Begin with a visit to the twin Temple of Kom Ombo, constructed as a tribute to Sobek and Horus. After lunch onboard, head to the Temple of Edfu, one of the best-preserved temples in Egypt. In the afternoon, enjoy some relaxation with tea as you sail to Luxor, spending the night onboard your cruise.

itinerary.title: Sailing to Luxor
itinerary.activities: Enjoy your breakfast onboard your Nile cruise ship while sailing to Luxor with lunch on board the vessel, then you will be guided for a wonderful exploration of the East Bank of the Nile in Luxor to Karnak Temple, the world's largest ancient religious site. The hypostyle hall with its colossal granite columns is one of Egypt’s famous landmarks. There will be free time to explore the different parts of the huge complex built during the reigns of various Pharaohs. Then you will be transferred to the majestic Luxor Temple which was built by Amenhotep III and Ramses II for ritual and festivals and dedicated to the God Amun. Lunch is provided throughout the day tours. Following lunch, you will be taken over to the West Bank of Luxor to explore West Bank of the River Nile in Luxor to the Valley of the Kings (the original resting place of the world-famous boy King Tutankhamun), and the Temple of Queen Hatshepsut (the only Female Pharaoh) at El Deir EL Bahari and the two towering statues of the Colossi of Memnon. (The three tombs visited are determined by the Egyptian Government as to preserve them from the large flow of visitors, therefore are rotated throughout the year and cannot be confirmed as to which tombs prior to your visit). After the tours, you will return to your Nile Cruise for an overnight stay Finalizing your Trips to Cairo & Egypt Trip Package.

itinerary.title: Fly Luxor to Cairo
itinerary.activities: Proceeding a delicious Breakfast on your Nile Cruise boat, you will be transferred around midday to Luxor Airport for the last of your trips to Cairo International Airport, On arrival, you will be transferred back to your hotel in Cairo for an overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Cairo - Fly Back Home
itinerary.activities: Proceed the last day of Egypt Trip Package by a Refreshing Breakfast at your Hotel in Cairo with plenty of Leisure time to do as you please before being transferred back to Cairo International Airport for your flight back home.
